The "Fair International Standards in Trade for the Americas Act of 1995" outlines the negotiating objectives for free-trade agreements in the Western Hemisphere, including worker rights and trade benefits. The United States aims to protect worker rights in international trade by ensuring freedom of association, the right to organize and bargain collectively, and establishing a minimum age for employment.
